Name: Taatuu-taatuu
Description: Children's game where players are firemen.  Players roll the die and move their fireman, putting on pieces of equipment or taking them off as dictated by the space.  When you land on a fire space, an inertia fire engine is pushed, and it speeds around the board: if it stops next to you, the fireman gets to put on two items.  First dressed wins.  No thought required.  The pieces are pretty decent to look at.

Name: Le jeu des 7 dictionnaires
Description:
French game based on a show of the RTBF (Radio Télévison Belge).

The player rolls a dice and advances, depending on the type of square he lands on, he might have to guess a definition, guess the author of a quote or even find the words that fit an appropriate combination of another word and its adjectives.

Some areas are specially indicated "dictionnaire" (which means dictionary) and on these areas the questions are related to different categories ( exotic word, lost word, regional word, literature, culinary word, French slang (argot) or words from the francophone world (ex: Quebec, l'Île Maurice, etc.). Each category has a color and a small wooden dictionary.

When a player has a correct answer on one of these areas, he wins the appropriate dictionary. To win the game, the player needs to get a preset number of dictionaries (determined at the beginning of the game by the players).

Name: Head1liners
Description:
This game contains 386 pictures.  The goal is to create the "best" headline for each picture.  All the players vote and the player receiving the most votes gets to move up.  
each player plays every time to create the funniest, most interesting or zaniest headline for the image.
The winner is the person that gets to the finish line by receiving the most votes for their head1lines.
If a player gets too far ahead they play with a handicap to keep the game competitive for players of all ranges.
This is a green game made from recycled materials.

Name: Conquest of Oz
Description:
Conquest of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the first in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series.  Card game for 2 players. 
Based on the Imaginary world of Oz. One player represents the forces of good. The other player is the forces of evil. The Good & Evil Characters each have their own unique Decks. The deck contains one of each card in the card list.
 Card Types include: Characters, Companions, Locations, Items, 
Modifiers, Powers, Attacks, Events

Name: Armies of Oz
Description: Armies of Oz is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the second in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series.  A full on battle for Oz! Large scale warfare in the Land of Oz. The map depicts an irregular, interlocked set of territories. Each Territory compromises a small section of Oz. Players will have to create their own Game Map.  The picture above shows a map of Oz taken from the original books.

Name: Oz Quest
Description: Oz Quest is a free game by Warp Spawn Games and is the third in Lloyd's Oz Trilogy series.  Based on the WarpQuest game system.  Each player takes the role of a child visitor to the Wondrous World of Oz.

Name: Television Empire
Description:
The aim of Television Empire is to build your own Television Network, buying resources and earning ratings, until your network has achieved supremacy.

From the publisher's website:

Choose the Shows... Build a Network...
Create the ULTIMATE Television Empire.

So you don't like what's on TV these days?
Think you could do a better job?

Well here's the chance to do it your way...

Television Empire is an exciting game of strategy and skill for 2-6 players. Compete to secure hit shows, hire trustworthy anchors and build network ratings.

Name: Golems
Description: Fantasy Wargame for 2-4+ players. You are a mighty Wizard. Use your Magic to make Golems to defeat you enemies. Use tiles to make the board. Units are created with a combination of size, shape, and material cards. Lots of Flavor and special fiddly rules. A fair amount of record keeping because each unit is unique. Free copy of the rules available at: http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Golem.html

Name: La Gerusalemme Liberata
Description:
"La Gerusalemme Liberata" is a simple boardgame with paper miniatures that represent the two factions involved: Tho Holy Crusade and the Arab.

The map board is the City of Jerusalem with strong wall perimeter.

Mechanics are similar to a chess game, where miniatures "eat" other miniatures according to rules which are used to determine which is stronger.

The game is for children, because the game has elemental strategy and  a few simple rules.

Name: Look Out Below
Description:
From the box:

'RAISE THE FIREMAN AS HIGH AS HE WILL GO
IN THE BALANCING GAME CALLED ... 
LOOK OUT BELOW'

'Raise the fireman on his ladders - higher and higher and higher!  Then, try to lower him down to earn points. But, if the ladders start swaying and the fireman falls ... you better LOOK OUT BELOW!'

Box measures 13" x 17" x 4".

The game consists of a molded plastic, bucket-carrying fireman about 8" high who stands on a platform which accepts plastic ladders that are inserted from below.  There are six colorful 8" long ladders, restricting the how far the fireman can be raised.  A large circular plastic fire net 12" in diameter is used to catch the falling fireman.  A colorful spinner directs gameplay.

Points are scored for raising and lowering the fireman (i.e. adding & then removing ladders) without causing him to fall (10 points per ladder). The fireman must be balanced by holding the bottom ladder ONLY.  Points are also scored if the player holding the net catches the falling fireman (50 points).

The first player to reach 150 points is the winner.

Name: Firehouse Mouse
Description:
From the box:

'IT'S A 5 ALARM FUN FILLED RIOT!

Lickety-split! Quick! Quick!
Before the mouse comes down the stick!'

'IDEA OF THE GAME - The object is to get 4 of the same cards before the mouse slides down the pole. This is done by drawing & passing cards just as fast as you can. Watch the mouse and try to guess which number he will point to when he lands because cards of that number become "wild".'

Box measures 12" x 22" x 2".

The 22" high firehouse backdrop (thick die cut card with period illustrations) is supported by a plastic base (which also serves as the spinner) and a red plastic roof; a metal rod connects the plastic roof to the center of the spinner.  A plastic mouse attached to a small doughnut shaped piece of plastic is slid onto the top of the metal rod and positioned to commence each round.

The spinner is used to designate 'wild' cards and to keep track of scores and round number. Players are dealt 5 cards; these are made of thick cardstock and are numbered 1-12, with 4 of each number. The mouse is nudged and set on its way. Players attempt to get as many of the same cards as they can by drawing & passing before the mouse reaches the spinner base. Only 5 cards may be held at any time.

When the mouse reaches the spinner below, cards are compared.  The segment which is occupied by the nose of the mouse becomes 'wild', so players can use cards of this number to enhance their hand.  The winner of the hand is the player with the highest number of identical cards, or the holder of the best cards if 2 or more players have an identical number of similar cards.

After 12 rounds of play, the WINNER is the player who has won the most hands.

Name: The Spider's Web
Description:
The Spider's Web is a game that helps children develop strategic thinking in an entertaining team environment.

Every roll of the dice gives players an opportunity to make a simple choice about the direction they want to move. The game pits a Spider player against one to four Firefly players who must escape from the web before the spider captures them.

Starting in the center of a spider's web, the Fireflies have to land on twigs in order to work their way off the web, but they need to stay clear of the Spider, who tries to land on them to send them back to their starting point.

When any one Firefly is able to escape from the web,  all the Fireflies win. However, if the Spider can catch the Fireflies four times before any of them escape, the Spider wins.

Awards:
    * Creative Child Magazine´s 2006 GAME OF THE YEAR
    * Dr. Toy´s 2006 Smart Toy/Smart Play Award
    * 2006 iParenting Media HOT AWARD
    * The National Parenting Center´s 2006 Seal of Approval

Name: Super Deformed Gundam World
Description:
This obscure Korean game is published by Jolly Game.  Notice that Jolly Game is not related to Jolly Games of Wiz-war, at all.

The game is one of multiple series of games that was sold for 1,000 KRW, which is about one USD.

The game contained a few plastic SD Gundam figures, with very simplified typical war game rules.

Name: Dragon Ball GT TCG
Description: Use Dragonball GT Warriors and try to defeat your opponent! Can either be played as a stand alone game, or with the cards from the Dragon Ball Z CCG in Extended Format.

Name: Dragon Ball Z TCG
Description: Use your favorite Dragonball Z Warriors and try to defeat your opponent! This game CANNOT be used with the Dragonball Z CCG or the Dragonball GT TCG

Name: Csillagok Háborúja
Description:
An old (1986) Hungarian game based on the Star Wars: New Hope film.

It is like other Escape from Death Star games but with different rules and board.

The Rebels have to escape from the Death Star by rescuing princess Leia and blowing up the tractor beam generator. Obi-Wan Kenobi has to fight Darth Vader.

The Imperials have to hinder the Rebels and have to blow up the Millenium Falcon.

The Rebel side: Chewbacca, Han Solo, R2D2, C-3PO, Luke, Leia, Obi-Wan and some rebel fighters with blasters.

The Imperial side: Darth Vader and numerous storm troopers

Disable the tractor beam, fight the storm troopers, prison block escape, stop the garbage compactor in time, fight Darth Vader...

Part of the Star Wars games family of games

Name: Stumpz
Description:
Stumpz is a cricket game from the famous Thomas De La Rue & Co. Ltd, makers of playing cards and printers of English Bank notes.

Stumpz is described as "The Indoor Cricket Game Played by The Australian Test Team, English Teams and Keen Cricketers Everywhere".

It contains many elements of cricket missing from many cricket board games, including being able to determine line and length, field settings and so on. The game is a small work of art and came in deluxe and budget versions (as far as I can tell). While the budget version has player pieces represented by small wooden tokens and a material play mat, the deluxe version has small, lead figures of cricketers in various poses, and a mounted board.

All in all a lovely little game in the small field of cricket board games.

Note: This game was published circa 1931 for the first time and was designed by Charles Goodall, the great grandson of the founder of playing card company, Goodall & Sons. The game was published by De La Rue following its purchase in 1922 of Goodall & Sons.

Name: Think: Cocktail
Description:
Players try to find the right ingredients that are specified on a given cocktail card by simultaneously collecting tokens.
All players act in real-time in this game. The tokens for ingredients must be collected in a specific sequence.
The player that can finish a cocktail card first collects the card for points.

Name: Zoff der Zünfte
Description: This is a variant of the classic "Ludo"/"Mensch ärgere dich nicht". The twist comes into play on a roll of 1 or 2: instead of moving, you may upgrading one of your own pieces from Boy to Journeyman to Master, or downgrade an opponent's piece. Each level can defeat other pieces of an equal or lower level.

Name: Abenteuer auf dem Zahlen-Fluss
Description:
Abenteuer auf dem Zahlen-Fluss is a game for children to learn easy calculations with numbers from 0 up to 100.

There are two different games included in the package, one is called "Flußurlaub", the other "Besuch von Neptun".

The first game is an area-control game where players win an area by placing 2 tokens of their color in the area. The areas contain numbers that represent results of calculations that a player has to do correctly.

The next game is a racing game where a die decides the place where the Neptune-figure has to be moved to. Players try to reach Neptune first by putting tokens on an area with numbers. The numbers are again results of calculations that a player has to do correctly.

Name: Latin Intervention
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game about the Cold War struggle for influence in Latin America. The winner is the first player to control five Central American countries, using methods such as monetary aid, agents, Marxist revolutionaries, or military presence.

Name: KHAN!
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of Kublai Khan's 1281 invasion of Japan. One player controls the forces of Kublai Khan while the other controls the Japanese forces. Khan needs to move his fleets from Korea to Japan, avoiding a moving hurricane, to defeat the outnumbered samurai units. The game uses a compact area movement map.
Families: History: Kamakura Period to Muromachi Period

Name: Upon the Stars Backs
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"As the Turkish union moves through the stars, a combined group of Euro-Union, and Japanese fleets move to protect their assets. Recently though the Turkish fleets have been growing ever so stronger with their eventual rise as a major space power. Right now they are attempting to land grab and then settle for peace!"

A simple game of spaceship fleet combat from the One Page Wars game series. Up to three players take on the GM controlled Ottoman forces.

Name: Devil Horsemen
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple solo (or two player) game of annihilating Napoleon's march from Russia. Cossack units are rated for speed and anger/patriotism, while the French units are rated for speed, military gain, and treasure gain. The cossacks (played by the solo player) tries to eliminate as many military gain points as possible before all of the French units have moved off the area map.

Name: That Little Crack?
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

"A crack to Hadell has just opened. Now skeletons and demons are pouring out of it! As the only three true heroes around, it is your job to hold the fort until backup arrives." A One Page Wars series game.

A barbarian, cleric, and archer fight a growing pack of skeletons in a narrow church. Each unit and monster is rated for power, movement, attack range, and hit points.

Name: Biathlon
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

Players compete in an Olympic biathlon event. Competitors from the US, France, Russia, Canada, and Italy seek to ski through the course with the fastest time while shooting accurately at three groups of targets. Each skier is rated for shooting accuracy and physical ability.

Name: By the Walls of Constantinople
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple game of ship to ship combat in 1453 from the One Page Wars series. Four Byzantine galleys try to break through a large contingent of Ottoman vessels and get to the Golden Horn. The mapsheet uses irregular shaped areas and the game abstractly covers boarding and ranged combat.

Name: Skiers
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players attempt to get down the ski slope in the fastest time possible. The slope is a string of connected spaces, each of which is rated for difficulty. You must choose between "normal" and "risky" movement. A die roll determines the success of each move. Ski for the US, Russia, Canada, France, or Italy.

Name: Battles: Win or Lose
Description: Battles: Win or Lose is a two-player game that challenges players to use instinct and intuition to defeat their opponent. Don the powers and strengths of 20 different characters and pit them against each other in an all-out slugfest of the fittest. Be the cunning Rogue, or the powerful Fire Mage. Swap blows with the Barbarian while your Thug hides, waiting for the opportunity to strike with deadly precision. Empower your party with the holy blessings of the Paladin or send your Opponent to the grave with the Necromancer. The way you play is up to you.

Name: Fairy Meat: WAR
Description:
From the Publisher's website:

In War, Straightedge Fairies, Greater Fae, Goblikes and Imps enter the scene! With amber armor, sunflower bombs, pistols, rifles and other dangerous weapons, the Straightedges bring squad-based war to the fairies! Goblike mercenaries strengthen this army (when they're not busy eating it), and Imps and Greater Fae likewise enjoy the new state of fairy affairs. After all, in the old days, it was frowned upon to senselessly riddle another fairy with a hail of arrows!

Even better, this 32-page Fairy Meat supplement features new rules for establishing ongoing campaigns!  With skill points, your fairies can learn as they kill and  become tougher than ever!  This book also includes rules for Fame, new printable warband and squad sheets, and much more! Although War is fully compatible with Fairy Meat, it is a supplemental rulebook only. Unless you already know how to play, you will need the Fairy Meat core rulebook in order to play effectively.

Expands:

    Fairy Meat

Name: Hölle auf Erden
Description:
From the Publisher's website:

Hölle auf Erden (Hell on Earth)

A Zombie Supplement for NUTS!

World War Two... The “Big One”, what’s not to like? Big tanks, rat-a-tat-tat machine guns, pin up art on airplanes. Oh yeah, what’s better than that?

Zombies! You know, the walking dead, “brains”, scary things that go bump in the dark. What is it about Zombies? Yeah, what’s better than that?

How about a WW2 game with Zombies? Now you’re talking! Welcome to HÖLLE AUF ERDEN or HOE.

What you have here is the blending of “NUTS!” the man-to-man skirmish game from Two Hour Wargames and “All Things Zombie”, the game of surviving during a zombie breakout. It’s about Allied forces in WW2 running into hordes of the undead as a result of Hitler’s last big gamble to win the war. 
If you’re looking for something a little bit different you’ve come to the right place. Go grab some figures and let’s get it started!

We've designed HOE to be played with any figures you already have and in any scale. So pull out those favorite figures, slip in your favorite Zombie movie, and remember... JUST PLAY THE GAME!

HOE is a supplement to “NUTS!” and not a stand-alone game. So you’ll need to have a copy of ”NUTS!” to play HOE.

Name: Tall Bird, Short Bird
Description:
In this children's game, players compete to create either the tallest or shortest birds, adding cards that show either a bird's head or its feet to the bird bodies on the gameboard.

To start, each player receives three cards. Each player chooses one card and places it face down in front of him. The first player calls out either "Tall bird!" or "Short bird!" That sets the criterion for the round. Each player then places the card he chose on the board, and the players determine who has the tallest or shortest bird, depending on which was called. The winning player gets an "egg," one of the cardboard counters used to keep score. Each player then draws a new card.

Play proceeds in the same way to the next player to the left, and cards are played on top of each player's existing cards on the board.

The game ends when the last card is drawn. The player with the most eggs wins.

This game is marked as "Piatnik Item No. 328," and probably was originally published in German in Austria. This summary is based on an English version printed in Austria but distributed by Discovery Toys of Martinez, Calif.

Name: Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway
Description:
Operation Weserübung: The Invasion of Norway covers the German invasion of Norway in 1940 during World War II. The game covers all aspects of the invasion, including land, naval, and air operations as well as the British and French involvement.

Operation Weserübung is a two-player or three-player game, with one player taking the Germans and the other player or players taking Norway and Great Britain/France. The game is regimental scale with each hex representing approximately 20-25 kilometers with turns representing four days. The combat system is roll-to-hit and the entire game system is based on the system from World War II in the West. This game is also a preview of what the system for World War II in the West: Ultimate Edition will look like when it is published in late 2007. Turn phases include the Air Phase, the Naval Phase, the Combat Phase, the Movement Phase, and the End Phase. The game includes everything from air interception to naval-air combat, from parachute drops to amphibious assaults. While the game strives to be an accurate simulation, the level of enjoyment and ease of play is also a priority.

The game is a medium to low complexity and should be easy to learn relatively quickly. The game can take approximately 5-8 hours to complete.

Operation Weserübung contains approximately 225 mounted counters in easy-to-cut strips. All historical land and naval units are represented in the game and individually identified. Divisional leaders are also included as well as an Admiral. All ships larger than a destroyer are individually identified and included, and air units are divided into counters representing a few squadrons of each type of aircraft. The Germans can call on the Messerschmitt Bf109 E, Messerschmitt Bf110 C, Junkers 87, Heinkel 111, and Junkers 52 during the game, while the Allies have a few Gloster Gladiators, Fairey Swordfish, Vickers Wellingtons, Capronis, and Hawker Hurricanes to try to stop the invasion. All air units have images of the aircraft on the counter while naval units have the historical profiles of the ship represented.

Counters are all two step and as shown in these pictures, have values on the top and bottom edge of the counter. Thus, the facing of the counter is important. This is similar to the system used in Distant Foreign Fields but a departure from the Second Edition of World War II in the West. Look for this feature in the Ultimate Edition of this latter game

Game Scale:
Game Turn: 4 days
Hex: 12-15 miles / 20-25 kilometers
Units: Regiments

Game Inventory:
Three 12 x 18" full color mapsheets
Ten single-side printed non-diecut counterstrips (240 5/8" counters)
One 24-page Operation Weserubung spiral-bound rulebook
One Player Aid card
Two 10-sided dice

Solitaire Playability: Medium
Complexity Level: Medium
Players: 2-3 or more
Playing Time: 5-8

Name: Napoleonic Battles
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple, generic Napoleonic battle game in which the British and French battle over cities at opposite corners of the mapsheet. Each side has infantry, cavalry, and artillery units, with each player being allowed to select the composition of their forces using a point system.

Name: WW2 France
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

In this simple World War II game, the Germans battle the US and British across an area map of France. Units are rated for attack, defense, and movement. There are two scenarios.

Name: Over Pakistan
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

A simple abstract game of modern air combat between India and Pakistan played out on a small area map. The object is to destroy all of the opposing aircraft. Aircraft are rated for attack and defense, and combat is resolved by die roll when opposing aircraft occupy the same area on the mapsheet.

Name: Animal Kingdom
Description:
A family card game for four or five players.

Players battle to build competing ecosystems between different animals.

Featuring 80 cards, each with a unique illustration, and four short pages of rules.

Name: Dial Away
Description:
This game was made for British Telecom.

Players must complete a given phone number , with the country, area code and the cost of the call.
To do that, players spin a dial and collect the needed numbers available on the section where the dial points at.

If players don't get the correct combination of numbers they must pay a forfeit consisting of talking about a certain topic for a minute.

Name: Que Pasa
Description:
A proprietary card game based on the standard social card game known in books as "I Doubt It," but more popularly as "Bulls**t." It was created by a college business professor in Alva, Okla., in the early 1990s and marketed by his startup company.

The deck consists of 72 cards in 14 denominations. Each denomination, numbered 1 to 14, depicts a leisure activity, such as "Golfing" or "Shopping." As in "I Doubt It," the object is to shed all your cards. Players announce in turn that they are discarding a certain number of cards in a certain denomination, always having the option to bluff. The other players can challenge. Anyone losing a challenge must take all the discards.

Unlike "I Doubt It," the game requires players in turn to play cards in the same denomination rather than increasing denominations. (In other words, if Player 1 plays "Hunting" cards and goes unchallenged, the Player 2 must either play "Hunting" cards or pass.) The denomination changes after a challenge -- or if all players pass, at which point the discard pile is retired and started anew. The game also includes a denomination of wild cards (1, "Anything Goes"), and one denomination (13, "Fooling Around") that can only be played as part of a bluff.

Once a player sheds all his cards, he scores the point total of all cards remaining in his opponents' hands. The game ends at 100 points. The game also offers rules for couples to play in partnerships.

Name: Three Dimensional Dominoes
Description:
From The Box...

Three Dimensional Dominoes

> 45 triangular dominoes, each with sectional numbers to be matched up as in conventional dominoes, but wait till you see the challenging differences.

> Six exciting "3-D" domino charts included.

>One Interesting "Solitaire" domino game chart included

Note: "3-D" dominoes was created and designed by mathematical experts following a specific formula. You will find the games most effective and more challenging when played on the design charts inside, whether for multiple or solitaire play.

> Full simple directions and charts inside box.

Name: Realms: Total War
Description:
The sounds of horns and the cries of men as they rush to battle, these sounds of war have been heard about the mighty Realms for ages. Now the battle of the many races has exploded into total war, a war to see who will rule the many lands of mighty Realms.

Realms, Total War, is the newest expansion for the Realms system. Now you can expand your Realms struggles with more tactical considerations, more magic, more troops and more fun. So gather a gang of friends together and have a few hours of glorious war, excitement and gaming fun.

Note that Realms, Total War, is not a complete game, and requires that you have one or more copies of the Realms games.

This game requires Realms: Elves & Orcs to play.

Name: Cinderella Glass Slipper Game
Description:
From the box:
"Will you be the first Cinderella to go to the ball? Collect 5 different cards and the Fairy Godmother will help you transform your cards to get ready for the ball. If you collect the invitation, the coach, the horses, the footman & the coachman as well as your ball gown, you will be the Cinderella who goes to the ball!"

Players move Cinderella pieces around a board, in the center of which is a glass slipper on a cushion. Land on the fairy godmother squares, press the slipper and it may transform the humble cards you have collected (mice, pumpkin etc.) into the things you need for the ball.

Name: Casino
Description:
Casino, "The Incredible All-In-One Game", was published in the Philippines in 1981.  The components is composed of a gameboard, various cards, play money, tokens, dice, and a rule sheet.

The gameboard has tracks around it wherein the tokens can traverse upon the roll of the dice just like in Monopoly.  But there are subtle differences: instead of streets the tracks are mostly illustrations of different Casino-related games.  When a player lands on a track with a specified game, he must play that game by placing a bet using play money and drawing the related card.  The card drawn will show the "summarized" result whether the player wins money or loses them.  There are also other types of tracks wherein any player who lands on them automatically loses money or gains some.

The object of the game is to win the largest amount of play money and avoid becoming bankrupt.

Name: Die drei ???: Geheimsache Ufo
Description:
Deduction card game based on the Three Investigators stories. The 3 ??? are Jupiter, Bob and Pete (in the German version - Justus, Bob and Peter). There are 3 types of suspect cards, place cards and mystery cards and 3 cards which show all 9, plus 3 detective cards (Justus, Bob and Peter), 4 player pieces and the gameboard.

Guess the gameplay could be described as Cluedo meets Go Fish!

Name: Wordlink
Description: This Scrabble-like game is made in India and is for 2 to 4 players, with a solo game option. Like Scrabble, players draw 7 tiles from a pool of 100 (including two blanks) and try to form words, crossword fashion, on a 16 by 16 square grid. The board includes bonus squares that double, triple or quadruple the word score. There are also squares that allow the player an extra turn. Scores are based on the number of letters in the word - the letters do not have differing point values: they are all worth one point each, except for blanks, which are worth nothing but can be used to represent any letter.

Name: Balance Cup Game
Description:
The Balance Cup Game (Wing Tat Hang Kee Co. Ltd.) is a simple dexterity game using plastic cups shaped like martini glasses. 20 plastic cups in four colors (including one white cup) are arranged in a pyramid with the white cup at the top. Players roll a special six-sided die that has three sides showing a black cup, and the other three sides showing a dot that is either red, green or yellow. If it shows a colored dot, the player has to remove a cup of the corresponding color. If it shows a black cup, the player can remove a cup of any color. The player who causes the white cup to fall loses, and has to rebuild the pyramid for the next game.

The Glass Tower Game (Daiso) is a similar game with the same sort of components but the opposite objective - players roll the die and then stack cups according to the die roll. On a roll of 1 to 4, the player has to stack a cup of the corresponding colour - no action if there are no more cups of that colour. On a roll of 5, the player can stack a cup of any colour, and on a six, the player does not need to stack any cup). The player who puts the last cup on top of the stack wins. Four different structures can be made with the cups, to play the game.

Name: Het Pinkeltje Spel
Description:
Who is the first to reach Pinkelotje?

Try to reach the forest at the other side and return home to Pinkelotje. Each player gets one pawn. You move your pawn by taking a "can I" card, then ask the player left of you if you may use the given card. He or she answers by saying "yes, you can" or "no, you can't". If you are not allowed to use the card, then take a "you cannot" card, and follow the directions on it. The board has some obstacles you must avoid. When you reached the forest, take your Pinkelotje picture and return home.

This game is based on the popular dutch character Pinkeltje from writer Dick Laan.

Name: AcaMania
Description:
AcaMania was designed by three national champion Academic Decathletes, with artwork by Tipatat Chennavasin. Players must race from the "pit" to the national competition, contending with four kinds of curriculum-related challenges--both creative and academic--along the way.

To make it around the board to the National Competition, teams of Decathletes must master five categories of game cards, ranging from the creative to the intellectual to the simply outrageous.  Depending on what cards they draw, players could be required to change events from the curriculum, mimic philosophical figures, hum the music pieces, sketch artworks, answer true/false questions, unscramble important phrases and much, much more.

Name: Syzigy
Description:
This chess-like game is played on a round board consisting of 157 circular spaces, connecting both circularly (around the board) and radially (from the outside to the center). The outer rings connect all the way around circularly, but the inner rings have gaps, requiring more complex routes to navigate.
Each player has 7 Sages, 4 Stouts, and 4 Royals (one of which is the Czar). The Sages move 5 circles, and may only capture Royals/Czars. The Stouts move 4, and may only capture Sages, and the Royals/Czars move only 3, but may capture  Stouts and Sages.
Capturing requires landing on an appropriate opponent piece. To win, you must capture your opponent's Czar, or all of either his Sages or Stouts.

Name: Fish Antics
Description: Fish Antics is a Go Fish variant in which cards specify how many matches you need to play it.  Cards have special abilities that activate once played.

Name: Zenergy
Description:
More than a boardgame, more than a word game or puzzle, Zenergy is a unique creative sculpture game.

Using the provided wooden blocks, you are asked to symbolize in sculpture ideas ranging from everyday events and objects to abstract concepts.

Challenging yet entertaining, thought provoking and often hilarious, Zenergy is a deceptively simple game and one that will provide hours of fascination.

Rebuild your imagination - play Zenergy.

For teams of 2 or more players, aged 15 to adult.

Contents:
54 wooden blocks
250 cards
1 board
2 dice
counters

Name: The Game of Captain Kangaroo
Description:
This game for children Ages 4 10 gets it title from an Educational Children's Television Program geared to pre-schoolers (1955-1980).

Captain Kangaroo (Bob Keeshan)  and Mr. Green Jeans (Hugh Brannum) starred .

This is s simple match the colors in order to move kind of game.

Name: Family Affair
Description: The Family Affair Game is based on a television show of the same name that was on the air in the late 1960's. The show starred Brian Keith as Uncle Bill Davis, Sebastion Cabot as the butler Mr. French, and the three orphaned kids, Cissy (Kathy Garver), Jody (Johnnie Whitaker) and Buffy (Anissa Jones - she died a couple of years after the show went off the air of a drug over-dose). This was a dice rolling game and had 4 cardboard cutout pieces each in 4 different colors.  What you rolled with the dice determined which area you looked at to determine what happened to you.

Name: Route 66
Description: This game based on the Television series of the same name featuring George Maharis as Buzz Murdoch and Martin Milner as Todd Stiles came with a simple board, 8 plastic playing pieces, 4 plastic cars, play money, a double spinner and road map instructions. The map had famous towns listed on it and the road map which was located inside the box had special instructions for the player who landed on particular spaces.  The object was to get your car located on the gameboard to complete the trip across the country.

Name: Riachuelo's Naval Battle
Description:
The Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is a war game for two players, that reproduces the riverine naval battle of June 11, 1865, where, during the War of the Triple Alliance (known in Brazil as the Paraguayan War). In this battle the admiral Barroso achieved an important victory, destroying a great part of the Paraguayan fleet.

The Naval battle of Riachuelo, was on the Paraná river, in the province of Corrientes, Argentina and is considered by the military historians as one of the most important battles of Triple Alliance War (1864-1865). It is also known as one of the main naval battles of the Brazilian Navy and it guaranteed the supremacy of Brazil in terms of naval control.

The game comes with the following components:
11"x17" Color Map
Rules Booklet with Designer and Historical notes
Player aids
Ship cards
45 counters

The game Riachuelo’s Naval Battle is the first game by Riachuelo Games to be released in English.

The Print-n-Play (PDF) version can be found at:
http://www.wargamedownloads.com/item.php?item=474

The Printed (DTP) version can be found at:
http://www.riachuelogames.com.br/

Name: Odisea Espacial
Description:
In "Space Odyssey", the players are technician-astronauts. Their mission is resolve all damages (of different sources) of a space station in a short space of time, because the auto-destruction is ON!!!

This Spanish game (around the middle of 80's) have plastic components of great quality. In this cooperative game each player select a character (pilot, mechanic, robot...) specializing in repair one class of damage. It's (probably) the first game in Spain with the mechanic of selection and specialization of characters.

En "Odisea Espacial" los jugadores son técnicos especialistas que han de reparar todas las averías (de diversos tipos) de una estación orbital en muy poco tiempo ya que... ¡¡La Auto-Destrucción se ha puesto en marcha!!.

Este es un juego español de mediados de los 80 con grandes componentes de plástico, y donde se experimentó (tal vez pioneramente) con los diversos papeles especialistas de los jugadores (piloto, mecánico, robot...) a la hora de resolver , cooperativamente, los diversos tipos de avería.

Name: Veja o Brasil
Description: Brazil's weekly magazine "Veja" contains news of Brazil and the world.  Veja o Brasil ("See Brazil") is a trivia game compiled from facts found in the magazine.  Move your pieces around the board and answer questions from six categories.  Contains 1800 questions on 300 cards.  Game is in Portuguese.

Name: Christmas Penguins
Description:
Christmas Penguins (Weihnachtspinguine) is a tactical dice game for 3-6 people.
Players take the role of thieving evil penguins, trying to steal presents from Father Christmas.
The aim of the game is to capture as many presents as possible, while Father Christmas, helped by a polar bear, tries to recapture the presents from the penguins. When Father Christmas reaches a penguin, the player whose penguin was reached takes the role of Father Christmas.
The winner is the penguin with the most presents at the end of the game. Because Father Christmas doesn't keep the presents, the player who is Father Christmas cannot win the game.

Name: The Comedy Company
Description:
The Comedy Company is just about to go to air, but the characters are scattered all over Pittswood Shopping Center! As trainee TV producer your job is to track down three of them then catch the bus back to the TV studio. Sounds easy but things keep changing along the way. You will need luck and strategy to win The Comedy Company.

Contents: The Comedy Company gameboard. Character cutouts and bases, Con The Fruiterer, Kylie Mole, David Rabbitborough, Uncle Arthur, Colin Carpenter & Russell the Postie. Player Tokens. Sets of three matching markers. Character pursuit cards. 136 Comedy Company cards. 2 Playing Dice.

Name: FlipFlash
Description:
From the box insert:

FlipFlash: The Spellbinding Game is a fast-paced extravaganza for two to twenty players incorporating 44 wooden, handcrafted tiles.  The object of this team sport is to create words by reeking havoc on opponents with feverish energy.  Guaranteed to be the most competitive and demanding game you've ever played.  And as each box is individually handcrafted, FlipFlash should well be deemed a choice piece of furniture.
FlipFlash comes in two variety of boxes and tiles: black and brown.  Individually hand-painted FlipFlash has 144 wooden tiles in three colors.  FlipFlash is suitable for those 10 years of age and over."

Name: Are You Phrazy? Holiday Carols Edition
Description:
In this version of Are You Phrazy?, players won’t be shouting out lyrics from Rudolph The Red-nosed Reindeer, White Christmas, or even Blue Christmas. They must SING them. Fast and loud. In fact, there’ll be no silent night in any little town when this devilishly divine game gets cranking. Each card features the song title from which the lyric originated. Customers will flock from afar to purchase such a unique holiday game.

For ages 8 and up. 4 to 12 singers. (Item #: GTL0602)

Name: Flail and Wail
Description:
The rhythm's gonna getcha in this beat-the-beat game.

Who knew you could learn rhythm while laughing? New Flail and Wail offers musical laughs and more. Best of all, players who might think they can’t keep a beat, let alone keep up, will have a riot clapping along, shouting with the song, waving, pointing and, well, Flailing. Each player passes the beat around by shouting a Wail sound and making a Flail move – first theirs and then another player’s. As the music speeds up, someone is going to mess up and that’s when Miss Dee Beat, the cranky music teacher, steps in. You’ll be in trouble when she gives you a dreaded treble (clef). Be the one with the fewest trebles and win. Game includes a fab CD featuring 50 original tunes to shout with and shake at. The game’s patented Magic Maraca rocks the dice.

Ages 8 and up. 3 to 8 players.

Copy of Home Page on Internet Archive: https://web.archive.org/web/20060323170503/http://gottalaffgames.com/FlailNwail.html

Name: I Know!: Gospel Word Match Game
Description:
"What is the Word of Wisdom? What is a Bishopric? What is Repentance? Do you know the answers? If you do, raise your hand. If you don’t, you’ll soon be able to say “I Know!” in this fun new game for the whole family. 
Four Games in One! Younger children will love playing the Match Game. Older kids will have fun with the Fill in the Blank or Guess Who games. Even adults can get in on the fun by acting out the questions in the Guess Who I Am game. Where can you find hours of fun for everyone? I Know!
"

Name: Animal Smackers
Description:
The board has air-holes in it and a plastic animal piece is placed over each one. Each air-hole is connected to a hole around the edge of the board. Using a small pump, players take turns to blow air into one of these edge holes, hoping it will correspond to an animal shown on one of the cards in their hand. The pump will cause one of the animals to jump upwards. If the animal matches a card in your hand, you can grab it and claim that animal. The winner is the player to collect the most matching animals.

For ages 6-12.

Name: Luftwaffe 1946
Description:
What if Word War II hadn't ended in 1945…?
What if Allied Air Superiority was challenged by new
Luftwaffe secret weapons…?
What if the Manhattan Project had been delayed…?

The historical end of the Third Reich occurred in May 1945, before the Luftwaffe could bring its advanced rocket and jet aircraft into full combat service. For over 50 years, historians have debated what could have happened if a number of events had ended differently. Ted Nomura and Ben Dunn of Antarctic Press have created a fictional world where several key events delayed the allies' victory. Fitting within the broader scope of the Families of Altered Wars fictional time line, Luftwaffe 1946 and Kamikaze 1946 describe WW II in the air from the view of pilots on all sides in the conflict.

What follows is just a brief overview of the circumstances that led to World War II continuing another year, giving the Luftwaffe and their counterparts in Japan a second chance. A chance to overcome their numerical weaknesses and training deficiencies through technology and the courage of their pilots. Suspend your disbelief, consider what might have been, and join us as we explore the people and story of LUFTWAFFE 1946.

Name: Kryomek: Hivestone
Description:
This vital extension to the original game includes:

Expanded Background Material
    Full explanations of the Solaric Rebel period, Colonial period, initial Kryomek encounters, Glindex Fork campaign, the Karanada Incident, the Kryomek Counter-Attack and subsequent Great Rebellion.

Army Lists
    Guidelines for creating forces for any of the detailed historical campaigns, including Great Swarm Kryomek.
    Army list for Kryomek 2nd Swarm

Points System
    New system allows players to construct balanced scenarios.
    Points list for human vehicles

Revised Stats
Stats for every unit in the game, revising those listed in the original rules, and adding many new unit types.  Stats list for human vehicles

New Units
Including Beta and Gamma strain Kryomek, Drones (Human-Kryomek hybrids), Swarmmasters, jet bikes, twisters (landing capsules), and the Talos T62 MS Cybernetic Battle Unit.

New Rules
Covering human rebels, cyclos (neural-regulated convicts), snipers, quadruped striders, twisters, jet cycles, Cybernetic Battle Units (CBU's), vehicular passengers, beta and gamma strain Kryomek, transomatic artillery and serumic pipes, Kryomek ballistae, Swarmmasters, Drones. New rules for collisions and overruns. New weapon categories and vehicle mountings. Updates to the Morale, Close Combat, Armour rules. Optional rules for evasion and opportunity fire.

Expands

    Kryomek

Name: Le combat des trente
Description:
The day is the 26. March 1351. The place is Brittany. The event is the meeting of sixty fighters and two captains in front of numerous people from the region.

On one side, the Montfort army with the English commander Bamborough, on the other the "blésistes" under command of Jean de Beaumanoir. That day, after epic events, the "blesists" won. Will your "combat des Trente" go the same way ? Or will you change the course of history ?

A game based on the books describing the historical events, but made by gamers / game developers.

Home Page: http://www.coop-breizh.fr/boutik-4/boutik-4/jeux-bretons-hoariou-59/le-combat-trente-933/zoom-fr.htm

Name: Space Fleet: Warp One
Description:
Space Fleet - Warp One is a tactical starship combat boardgame. The tactical level uses counters or miniatures to represent individual starships in combat. The playing area is a hex sheet that you supply. Players design starships on paper then take these designs into combat. Once in the tactical simulator the players take turns moving and firing their starships. Combat is resolved quickly and simply with two six sided dice. "

Download PDF at : Space Fleet - Warp One
Rules available at: Space Fleet - Warp One

A simple tactical space combat game, with a small set of ship design rules included.  Almost like a minimalist Starfire.

Name: Det 5 Element
Description: Card game from Denmark. Set contains 60 cards, 1-13 in four suites corresponding to four elemental forces (fire, sun, moon, water) plus 8 Tornado cards. Instructions are in Danish, so remaining mechanics are unclear.

Name: Lake Winnipesaukee: Follow the Mount
Description:
Lake Winnipesaukee is a Monopoly clone with a few small changes.

Players race around Lake Winnipesaukee, hoping to be the first to land on a piece of lake real estate.  When a lot is owned, rent can be collected.  The amount of rent depends on what is built on the lot.  If you own just one lot of a three lot group, you can build a picnic area.  If you own two, you can build camp grounds.  Finally, if you own all three lots, you can build lodges, which rake in the most rent.

Random lots around the lake contain actions, rather than lots for sale.  Any fees incurred by these lots are placed into the center of the lake, to be collected by the lucky player who lands on the correct lot.

Play continues in this fashion until one player emerges as the only left with cash.

Name: W Cieniu Saturna
Description:
In 2093 the Marsian revolt de-organised the economic structure of the Solar System. While the United Sates and Japan put on on the program of colonization, the European Economic Community and Hegemony Of East Asia were exploring the outer planets of the System. The main new colony became Titan - the biggest of Saturn's Moons. The first period of colonization was going in cooperation but in 2117 economical and territorial quarrels let to the outbreak of war.

First game in Sfera's Seria Miniatur.

It was an unlicensed copy of SPI's Titan Strike! Battle for the Moon of Saturn.

Name: Italia 90
Description:
This game was born to simulate the 1990's Soccer World Championship in Italy.
It's a card management game in which you've to play against fictional teams or teams belonging to other players.
The team is composed by 3 cards (of the 6 everyone receive at the start of the game) representing the defensive zone, midfield and attack zone. 
The game simulate the teams groups, semifinal and final match of the championship with event cards, money management, players management and so on.

Name: Blood Diamonds
Description:
Blood Diamonds pits west African warlords against one another for control of rich diamond fields. Your goal is to acquire as many diamonds as you can and sell them for the highest profits.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a "SixPack" (1½ piecepacks).

Name: Chameleon
Description:
The players jointly build the board, one tile at a time, as the game progresses. Each time a player places a tile that forms a group of three or four like-colored tiles, that player receives points, with the quantity depending on the group configuration and on chameleon (pawn) positions on the board. If a player places a tile adjacent to a wasp (die), he loses points to the wasp’s owner. The player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack with a four seasons expansion and pawn saucers.

Name: Goods from Cape to Cairo
Description:
Players are the proprietors of long distance haulage companies in Africa, competing for goods delivery contracts in a tough economic environment. The player with the most money after 6 turns wins the game.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack or a playing cards expansion (and 3 markers for each player).

Name: It's a Weird, Weird Galaxy!
Description:
It’s a Weird, Weird Galaxy! is a space race and resource management game. Each player, starting from their home world, flies their starship about the galaxy engaging in interstellar trade in order to earn enough Space Bucks to build a string of space stations stretching from their home world to the center of the galaxy. The first player to complete their seventh space station wins. However, nothing is that easy! Each space station cost more than the last one to build. Each space station also impedes the path of opposing starships. Finally, there is this weird space alien, affectionately known as “Phredd”, and looking vaguely like a camel the size of a small moon that randomly flies around spitting on stuff and generally balling up the works. But, hey! It’s a weird, weird galaxy!

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, designed for a standard piecepack and one expansion (plus 12 counters for each player).

Name: Scavenger Hunt II
Description:
Find the items on your list...but first find your list!!

Players explore a board made of face down tiles claiming tiles to build their list and finding the coins for their tiles (items in the list).

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for any two different piecepack sets, totalling eight suits.

Name: Sheep
Description:
The object of the game is to move all your sheep to their shepherd. A number of sheep-dogs on the board may block the sheep, making the shepherd's job much more difficult.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the playing card expansion.

Name: Spam-O-Rama
Description:
Your goal is to conduct successful spam e-mail campaigns for the clients (companies, groups or products) you have been hired to represent.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for three different piecepack sets (12 suits).

Name: Stacked Deck War
Description:
For years Spades, Hearts, Diamonds and Clubs had the exclusive claim to the game commonly known as `War'. In the world of playing cards, all was well. One day Suns, along with Moons, Crowns and Arms decided they wanted to take the game of `War' for their own. The playing card clan grew angry at the piecepackian army. With all rational reasoning and compromises ignored, the two rivals soon decided to stack their decks and play the ultimate game of war, for rights of the game of `War'.

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for a standard piecepack and the playing cards expansion.

Name: Tribes of the Four Seasons
Description:
Each player represents a tribe that is striving to have the most influence over the resources available to the various settlements of the land.

The aim of the game is to have the tribe that exerts the most control over the resources of the settlements at the end of the game. The four tribes are Winter, Autumn, Summer, and Spring. Each tribe is good at using one specific type of resource, so needs to gather as much of the other 3 resources as possible. The resources are water (white snowflake), wood (orange leaf), animals (purple fish) and grain (light blue flower).

This game was an entry to the Mesomorph 1 Piecepack Contest, and is designed for the  piecepack four seasons expansion.

Name: Future Race
Description:
Miniatures rules to recreate pod racing from Star Wars Episode I.

Players create track terrain and use these rules to navigate it with their vehicles. Movement order is determined by card draw. Speed is selected each turn, but movement is ultimately determined by a die roll. Bumping rules provide player interaction. Advanced rules are included for different vehicle types and weapons.

Name: Mondkälber-Treiben
Description:
This game is handmade at home by Martin Ebel in 300 Copies.
It is a collection of different games.
The game consists of 7 hollows, marbles in different colors, stones and wooden sticks from Ice cream.
The basic system is, that the players have to push the marbles with the sticks in the hollows.

Name: Hee Haw
Description: Game includes:  animal gameboard with self-contained metal spinner and set of 24 animal cards. The game involves dealing cards equally to all of the players. The starting player spins the arrow spinner and when it stops on an animal, each player that has a corresponding card in their hand tries to be the first to call out the sound made by that animal.  First one to get rid of all their cards is the winner.

Name: Perfect Bowling Game
Description:
This bowling game comes with a bowling alley that measures 25” long by 6” wide.

It works by having a bowling figure that can be moved from side to side to aim your shot.  The ten pins are set in the location holes and when they are all in place you push the locater into the down position. This lifts the locater set up and gets the lane ready for a frame.  You then push your bowling figures' arm back to lock him in position and place your ball in the groove. When you are ready press the button to release the bowlers arm and bowl.

Afterwards the ball return dispenser will return the ball back to the bowler When the ball gets back to you, you press a button and the ball pops up ready to use again.

Game includes score sheets so you can keep score
The bowling alley measures 25” long and 6” wide
comes in a display box

Name: Ript Revenge
Description: The sequel to 2004 KnA Games release Ript. Ript Revenge puts a new twist on the familiar game. While playing, Disc Golfers compete for skins on each hole. When players win a hole, they get any skins available for that hole. Everyone else gets cards that can be used to play against their opponents. Featuring new cards such as Mini Drive, Roller and more, this new exciting way to play gives players a chance to burn opponents and get revenge!
Families: Admin: Outside the Scope of BGG

Name: The Teen-Time Game
Description:
A self-described "game for pre-teen and teen age girls and boys," this game is all about inter-personal relationships. Boys and girls start at the same point on the board and advance using a spinner to determine the number of spaces to move. Depending upon the square on which you land, you may gain points, lose points, receive other information ("Boy meets girl") or instructions ("Advance to mall"). Some squares instruct you to draw a bonus card, which will also give or take away points, grant another turn or deny your next turn, you may even draw the "Engaged" card.

At two different points on the board, the girls' path and the boys' path diverge. Girls, may then land on a square that says, for instance, "Break heel dancing. Lose 1 turn." Boys can suffer no such fate, but can only gain points, lose points, meet girl, break up, etc.

Winner is the first player to reach a pre-determined number of points.

Name: Perception: The Ultimate Word Game
Description:
Thinking fun for all the Family

Perception is a game of words- secret words- that only you or your partner know - ONE WORD clues are given as to what that secret word may be - Does your partner have the perception to guess what it is from the clues you give!

Ages 12 and over.

Name: Wall Street The Board Game
Description:
The objective of WALL STREET is to make money through the trading of stocks, futures, gold and securities. The first player to double the initial amount of money that they started with is the winner of the game. An optional approach is to set a given time of play and the player who has the greatest amount of wealth is the winner.

Game consists playing board, market guides, portfolio sheets, money, pawns, dice and stock, futures, gold & securities cards.

Name: Paws 'N Claws
Description:
In Paws 'N Claws, your goal is to work your way from the outermost track of the playing board to the inner areas, eventually entering the judging and placing first in the show. Along the way you must demonstrate your breeding and training by correctly answering questions about dogs and cats.

There are three categories and two levels of questions, which are determined by the roll of the dog and cat dice.

There is also the possibility you will have to bark or meow or make some other noise or gesture by drawing Claw or Paw cards.

The board is a bit tricky but careful observation and maneuvering will solve it.

Name: Media Magnate
Description:
Media Magnate is a game of strategy and chance in which players acquire power and wealth through buying and running newspapers and magazines, radio and television stations and international media networks.

It accurately reflects the real and unpredictable world of media wheeling and dealing from the newspapers to the boardroom.

The game involves all players every time the dice is thrown. The first player to acquire a complete Media Empire is the winner.

Name: Grabbage & More
Description: Grabbage is a card game where 2 or more groups of people try to obtain 4 of a kind in a deck of cards. Once collected, the person having the winning hand secretly signals his partner to stop play by saying "Grabbage". Cards are traded in the center of play, and scoring is based on whether you get your secret signal out without the opposing team picking up on it.  Grabbage & More also comes with 10 other solitaire and group card games. Grabbage & More comes with 3 decks of playing cards, rules on a ring, 10 scoring chips, a wipe-able scorecard and marker, and a bag to carry it all in.

Name: Vilajet
Description:
Vilajet is a Hungarian game about the Turkish-Hungarian Wars set in the medieval times. Unfortunately it is only Hungarian language, but easily translated into English.
 The game map represents about 100x100 km territory near Lake Balaton, and shows little villages, towns and cities. In those times between these two countries there at peace, but there were a lot of border disputes which eventually caused a battle to be fought. Those are simulated in this game.
 The players should build armies in their castles, improve their current defenses and collect taxes from villages, while trying to work against the enemy opponent.
 Battles are one of the unique features that this game has. When you have a battle you take the "battle" map, and place your army there. On the strategic map you only have one counter, which shows only the name of the army, but you have to administrate, what kind of troops that army consists of (250 Hussars, 85 Infantry...etc). On the battle map you take the corresponding counters, and play battles with them, writing down casualties. Every unit has different fighting/moving values. The sieges are also great! Another map is used (there are about 6 different castles), and modified by the defenses you have built since the start of the game. It also has some extra rules, which make sieges fun. (for example when you go for a siege, you have to decide how much grain you will bring with you)

The good side of the game is that the Hungarian and the Turkish sides really differ from each other, and need completely different playing styles.

Of course, the game has a downside. The amount of administration needed to play might cause the casual player to never sit down and play a game.

This game is great in Hungarian history, and shows those times, which were so full with death, battles and instability.

Name: Schwerpunkt: Divisional Level WWII Fast Play Rules 1920-1950
Description:
Schwerpuckt is a set of miniature rules for playing large WW2 battles.  Each stand is 1 company, 1"=200 yards, and 1 turn = 30 minutes.  Most mechanics use single die rolls with situational modifiers to speed play.

Rules are 20 pages, and cover the usual fire, movement, and morale rules.  Army lists and scenarios will be posted on the Web site:

http://www.freewebs.com/tommiatkins/

More info from the Web site:

World War 2 is a incredibly well supported area as regards wargame rules...... for skirmish or company level rules.

What's out there for Brigade and above? Spearhead? (Rolls around on floor in stitches, gasp! gasp!) Yeah there is a set of rules that reflects reality! Oooh yes please!

What's actually needed, is a set of rules that reflects the kind of decisions that a commander at this level takes.

Is their command attacking or defending, are they dispersed or concentrated? What is the units strengths and weaknesses? The penetration ability of a Sherman easy eight vs a PzKpfw IV's rear plate is NOT on his mind.

That his light tank battalion are probing towards the objective supported by a Elite mechanized infantry battalion will be.

SCHWERPUNKT

Schwerepunkte is different to any WW2 miniatures rules in this respect. It takes you to the Divisional HQ and asks you to make the kind of decisions that will spell victory or defeat. Dice are involved, good equipment will help, but it's YOUR actions that will carry or lose the day.

The usual tommiatkins "one roll of a D6" settles combat, players will be in command of Infantry, Engineers, Artillery, Armour, Signallers,(get those unused radio cars out)and Military police etc. Anti-Aircraft fulfills its true role instead of being "another Anti-tank" unit.

Schwerpunkt will allow 6 players to fight Arnhem with every unit involved in a full day with time to get totally hammered on cheap red wine afterwards.  Two players can do Arras 1940 to a conclusion in 20 minutes.

So, If your fed up with rolling a hundred dice in FOW, and knowing that if you roll higher than your opponent then you've won, keep your eyes open for Schwerpunkt.

So what do we have?

Heres whats in already:
1) Minefields
2) Signals
3) Military Police & Kommisar's
4) Night Fighting
5) Squadron level air support, Air recon and AAA
6) Harrassing artillery fire & on-call fire missions
7) Bridging and demolition
8) Detached company support units
9) Ambushes approach and surprise fire
10) Combined arms supporting
11) Engineers
12) Formation's (I.E: Concentrated/Dispersed/All Round defense/ Deploying)
13) Airborne assault and Marines
14) Real Reconnaissance

Name: Super Sentence Cube Game
Description:
"Roll out the words - roll out the laughter - making sentences before the timer runs out"

This game consists of 25 dice with words on each side, a dice cup and a large sand-timer. Players roll the dice and make sentences with the words. A sentence with 7 or more words scores a bonus 50 points, using all the dice scores a bonus 50 points, and the score for a sentence is the square of the number of words in it.

This game is published in India where apparently "FLET" and "ATER" are words. The dice are not cubes, they're shorter in one dimension than the others.

Name: The Battle of Lanka
Description: This is a game conceived by Kreeda, and is the third part of the Ramayana series. In the Indian epic - the Ramayana, Dasharatha, Rama's father is forced by an old promise to send Rama, his eldest son away to the forest for fourteen years. Rama is accompanied by his wife Sita and brother, Lakshmana. Vanavaas - the Adventures in the Forest follows their experiences until the kidnapping of Sita. In the second game, the Search for Sita, you follow the adventures of Rama and Lakshmana as they search for Sita and seek the help of the vanaras or monkeys. Hanuman finally finds Sita in Lanka where she is a prisoner of the demon king - Ravana. Rama and Lakshmana, along with their new friends Sugriva and Hanuman decide that the only option is to fight a war with Ravana and rescue Sita. It was a mighty battle fought between the rakshasas led by Ravana and the vanara army led by Rama. This game brings you face to face with some of the unforgettable characters like Kumbakarna, Indrajit and Jambavan. It also introduces you to many of the special powers that gave both sides the numerous advantages. Rama is invincible and represents the Power of Good. However, in the epic he is told to seek the assistance of the vanaras led by Sugriva. It is this that led to the concept of the game. The game is based on C. Rajagopalachari's Ramayana in English. Contents: One pack of 52 cards, Rule sheet.

Name: Physogs
Description:
This is a card game with a difference, combining the principles of an identikit, with the game play of collecting and matching sets typical of card games.

The object of the game is not merely the piecing together of features but the building of faces, the features of which are consistent with each other. The eyes, nose, mouth etc. must not, in its respective ‘character’, conflict with any other feature. It is possible, by various combinations of these cards, to form 13 different types of facial character and the types are described on the type cards and in the key book.

This game is not to be likened in any way to a jigsaw puzzle. It is a definite character analysis by the use of real photographic reproductions, invented by Jacques Penry, the author of "Character from the Face" (published by Hutchinson) and contributions to the "Sunday Express".

Name: Obstinate Beyond Description
Description:
The game is Leader driven. His characteristics and qualities coupled with circumstances will dictate what a force can and cannot do. The closer you are to supplies, the more you can do- unfortunately you can’t win by sitting in a supply depot.
A turn is played in operations. Players alternate operating with a force and Leader of their choosing, trying to outmaneuver their opponents and lever them out of commanding positions, opening up strategic objectives. Beware; although you may be only a mile or so from your objective, stretched supply lines, bands of guerrilla fighters and incompetent Generals can force a sudden retreat, undoing careful planning.

The board is divided into supply areas (color coded) that can change due to territorial acquisitions. While the British begin with excellent supplies near Lake Ontario, the loss of Fort George can mean restricted movement in your own heartland. If the Americans lose Fort Schlosser, the British will have a free hand marching to Black Rock or Buffalo, causing the Americans to retire in shame from the Canadian side.

Battles, Skirmishes, and guerrilla activity not only leads to the loss of men, but of confidence, and an army that loses hope will degenerate into an armed mob, incapable of organized action. Both sides were determined during this campaign, so battles tended to be hard fought, and cause high casualties, even among the Generals.

The Scale

The Niagara region in not a huge one. An army could march from the top to the bottom in two days (in peacetime).We use two day turns, which allows for the tiniest of actions and moves to be of significance. As far as troop scale is concerned all units used in play are called Detachments, which represent between 100-200 men. Thus the British 100th
regiment (roughly 600 men) is composed of four detachments.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Battle of Guararapes
Description: Battle of Guararapes is a wargame for two players with cover the first and second Battle in Pernambuco(state of Brazil), in Brazilian colonial era, against the Dutch domination. The Pernambucana Resistance march with 2000 man against an enemy better equipped and in superior numbers. In April 18th 1648, the battle begins!

Name: Luftwaffe 46
Description:
Second Ediiton Notes

With the end of the 2nd. world war, the world enters a new political configuration headed by two great blocs: the United States and the Soviet Union. Despite the climate of hope in the division of defeated Germany, a series of suspicions begin to emerge among the old allies. The Russians with control of so-called Eastern Europe awoke among Western allies suspected of a possible breakthrough in 1946.

The Americans along with the British began to reposition the bulk of their troops on German frontiers and began a program to ship supplies and ammunition to their units. In 1947 the Russians also began to move in this chess, with the increase of their military personnel in occupied Germany. In 1948 the first course occurs when Stalin’s armies block Berlin, barring access to supplies and new troops.

The American response comes in two nuclear attacks, one on Moscow with a new American bomb called BlueToddler and another attack on the Soviet heavy industries in the Urals with 3 small tactical bombs known as Nuke Candy. The Russians advance their conventional forces on the allies and a new conflict begins. The allies are now mortal enemies, on the one hand, the Americans, the English, and the French, and on the other hand the Russians and the Chinese, who proclaim themselves communists in 1947, joining the so-called Soviet Federation.

In 1949 is invented by the Russians the engines of macro combustion enabling the introduction of so-called combat mechs. These armaments recover the ground lost by the Soviets, pushing the allies to the borders of Poland. In 1950 the first Russian nuclear bomb explodes over New York, taking the world war to the American soil! In 1951 the Allies entered with their mechs of combat in Europe, bringing the conflict to unimaginable levels.
In this scenario, a powerful organization arises, formed by old Nazis who dream of having a great Germany again: the Werwolf Korps. Hidden in the Bavarian Alps in deep Nazi fortresses, they emerge as a fighting force with fantastic weapons and black magic. These represent one more weight in the pendulum of history.

Luftwaffe 46 is a jet fighter game set in the world of Hotwar, where the war doesn’t end in 1945 but continues as Germany launches its other jet plane projects and fights the allies in dogfights. The rules were made for you to play with miniatures in 1/300 scale, in the absence of them, we supply markers to replace them.

What you will need to play:

1 measuring tape
2 six-sided dice (known as d6)
1 smooth surface (a dining room table for example)
Rulebook (you are reading it now)
Paper and pen
Miniatures for 3D printing (STL FILES) - Available for download, links in the end of the rule book
